Background # The histogram of a digital image depicts how the intensities of its pixels are distributed. It is the discrete function h such that \[ h(x) = n_i \] where \(n_i \) is the number of pixels with intensity \(i \) . Histograms are used to quickly analyze the composition of an image, it can be used in RGB composition, gray scale, brightness or the system that best suits our needs.
